etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Richard Tomlinson (fl. 1657). From post-classical Latin malaxatio from classical Latin malaxāt-, past participial stem of malaxāre + -iō

definitions: The action of reducing ingredients to a soft mass by kneading or rolling.
The action of repeatedly squeezing captured prey between the mandibles prior to feeding, characteristic of fossorial wasps.
